DataElement.preferredName: Gene Editing Infused Product Cell Count Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric laboratory percentage value measured, assigned or computed related to the gene edited cell count in the product (e.g.,human drugs; therapeutic biologics; allergenics; cells, tissue and gene therapy products; blood components and blood derivative products).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gene Editing Infused Product Cell Count Percentage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any gene manipulation method used to generate a product with an altered sequence, structure, or conformation._Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord._A thing produced by or resulting from a process. EXAMPLE(S): drug, device. The FDA list of regulated products: animal and human drugs; therapeutic biologics; allergenics; cell, tissue and gene therapy products; blood components; blood derivative products; devices; and animal (pets and livestock) and human food/feed (medicated and un-medicated); cosmetics; pet treats; and dietary supplements._A procedure to determine the number of cells in a sample._A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any gene manipulation method used to generate a product with an altered sequence, structure, or conformation.

Concepts.definition: Any gene manipulation method used to generate a product with an altered sequence, structure, or conformation.
